Regarding the "canonical tensor" it's hard, because the module can have a lot of different parameters that have different types and are on different devices.
I agree that .new().long().resize(x, y) chains are awful. I think .new_long(x, y) (and similar for all other types) would be a convenient helper.

body:
Regarding the "canonical tensor" it's hard, because the module can have a lot of different parameters that have different types and are on different devices.
I agree that `.new().long().resize(x, y)` chains are awful. I think `.new_long(x, y)` (and similar for all other types) would be a convenient helper.
